content: One option is to use the mailmerge addon and save as draft and then release a few (manually) at a time. BUT, for long-term use, I strongly advise you to use a mailing service, such as Mailchimp or others. Several of these services allow a few hundred a month for free.

content:
The other thread you're referring to was merely the user not understanding what was happening. There was no problem to solve there, it was working as expected, hence why no follow ups.

It isn't clear whether that's your case as well or not. Is it that Google keeps repeatedly asking you to authorise Thunderbird, even after you've completed the authorisation process? Or is it that you don't understand why it's doing so? Because if the latter, it could simply be that the OAuth token kept by Thunderbird to be able to connect to the server has expired and Google requires you to authorise Thunderbird again…
creator: DavidGG

content: There are other ways to create a new message, that's not the only way, but you may make the button appear by choosing View > Folders > Folder Pane Header in the menu bar.
creator: DavidGG

content:
That would depend on whether the accounts were set up as POP or as IMAP, i.e. whether your mail is being stored locally or on the server. Obviously anything on the server will be gone when the accounts are cancelled…

But you may avoid this problem entirely, regardless of the type of account, by creating custom folders under Local Folders, at the bottom of the list of accounts in the folder pane, to store and organise your mail locally on your computer there however you wish, independently of any account you may have. Mail stored there won't be affected by the accounts being cancelled or even by you removing the accounts from Thunderbird yourself.
creator: DavidGG

content: ANO. Zmeňte si úložisko napr. na disk E:/EMAIL - Thunderbird - Nástroje - Nastavenie účtov - Úložisko správ - Lokálny priečinok a tu zmeňte priečinok napr. na E:/EMAIL hotovo a odteraz všetko z tohoto účtu sa bude ukladať na druhý disk do zvoleného priečinka (aj archívy)

content: If you are composing new HTML message or forwarding an HTML message, there is a nice addon, textmarker, that does a nice job of this. I am unaware, however, of any way to highlight text in a received message otherwise.
